history.review_excerpt: The Andi Comstock Supernatural Mystery series continues with PENITENCE by the talented writer, Ann Simas. This is a great, easy and fast paced read. Andi is back talking with the dead. This book is about an unnerving conversation with someone who recently died  about what he has planned for his spouse. This book is full of intrigue, suspense with some sex thrown in for interest. It has a great outcome but that leaves you in suspense right up until the end. Highly recommend for a great summer read. Can't wait for the next in the Andi Comstock series.
history.review_full: The Andi Comstock Supernatural Mystery series continues with PENITENCE by the talented writer, Ann Simas.  This is a great, easy and fast paced read.  Andi is back talking with the dead.  This book is about an unnerving conversation with someone who recently died  about what he has planned for his spouse.  This book is full of intrigue, suspense with some sex thrown in for interest.  It has a great outcome but that leaves you in suspense right up until the end.  Highly recommend for a great summer read. Can't wait for the next in the Andi Comstock series.

history.review_excerpt:
The first 30-50% is very difficult to get through, at least for me. After that it does get more action and more plot. I felt the human characters were quite flat and boring. Main character very fixated, like annoyingly so, about someone who clearly is no longer interested, yet goes overboard all the time for them.

It had a lot of good elements and surprises.

I guess the lesson here is not to touch things that don't belong to you.
history.review_full:
The first 30-50% is very difficult to get through, at least for me. After that it does get more action and more plot. I felt the human characters were quite flat and boring. Main character very fixated, like annoyingly so, about someone who clearly is no longer interested, yet goes overboard all the time for them.

It had a lot of good elements and surprises.

I guess the lesson here is not to touch things that don't belong to you.

history.review_excerpt: I like a lot of Hughes stories but really was waiting for that WOW moment most of his stories have. This wasn't for me. It was well written just not what I prefer to read. While fiction it was all reality based, nothing futuristic or out of the ordinary, not really my pace.
history.review_full: I like a lot of Hughes stories but really was waiting for that WOW moment most of his stories have. This wasn't for me. It was well written just not what I prefer to read. While fiction it was all reality based, nothing futuristic or out of the ordinary, not really my pace.

history.review_excerpt:
Wonder if it would translate well on film?
Besides my plot holes below I really did love this and was really great on many levels.

Spoiler alert!!!!!!

For those who have read it, for me the plot holes are that the person who previously ran the ferry to the island would have had to of been in the know of what was going on as well as the captain of the Standard. So how would the ferry captain and captain of the Standard be able to ignore groups of people just never coming back to the boat every year. They don't mention a garden anywhere but they had tons of different food and ingredients to make all these dishes. No goats mentioned being kept, so how did they get it, it would spoil after years and years in storage.
history.review_full:
I completely enjoyed this and didn't expect it from the title or little description I read. I devoured this. There are one or two small plot holes but otherwise I really really loved this. Wonder if it would translate well on film?
Besides my plot holes below I really did love this and was really great on many levels.

Spoiler alert!!!!!!

For those who have read it, for me the plot holes are that the person who previously ran the ferry to the island would have had to of been in the know of what was going on as well as the captain of the Standard. He said he had been doing it for the last six years. The animals on the island said they have been doing the hunt every year for years and years. So how would the ferry captain and captain of the Standard be able to ignore groups of people just never coming back to the boat every year. They just shrug it off and go about their business? They would absolutely have to know something was up.
Also, with all the missing people there absolutely would have been investigations being that the last place they were going was Addington island. People would have gone to search.
Finally, who had been bringing them food? They don't mention a garden anywhere but they had tons of different food and ingredients to make all these dishes. Like, they aren't making their own flour and sugar. The cook mentions to the rabbit about where did he get the squash and was it on sale. Maybe this was just a joke but they mentioned goat cheese. No goats mentioned being kept, so how did they get it, it would spoil after years and years in storage. Even flour and other stuff wouldn't be as good Someone on the outside absolutely had to know about them.

heldout.review_excerpt: I do not play chess. I have never understood it, but I understand the feeling of passion for something you love and love to be good at. I felt excited reading the moves and reading about chess plays. I felt the highs of the games and the soreness in the losses. I saw the Netflix show first and loved it but the true feelings came while reading. I have actually started to learn chess online. Whether you love chess or know nothing about it and find it boring, there is plenty to love and feel from this story.
heldout.review_full: I do not play chess. I have never understood it, but I understand the feeling of passion for something you love and love to be good at. I felt excited reading the moves and reading about chess plays. I felt the highs of the games and the soreness in the losses. I saw the Netflix show first and loved it but the true feelings came while reading. I have actually started to learn chess online. Whether you love chess or know nothing about it and find it boring, there is plenty to love and feel from this story.

history.review_excerpt:
Easy 1-2-3 set up
The box includes the software CD, along with the headset (jack output, not USB). In addition, you can use the download version from their website which is what I did.
I used the Dragon Naturally Speaking download version on a Windows 8.1 laptop. I wasn't sure if it was just the antivirus software that was being touchy or if it was an actual virus. I then ended up using the CD for download to play it safe.
The program is very easy to use. There were a few typos along the way, maybe because I speak fast. The software kept up with me though! You need to tell the program when you want punctuation.
I only hesitate on the 5 star due to the virus on their download site.
history.review_full:
Easy 1-2-3 set up
The box includes the software CD, along with the headset (jack output, not USB). In addition, you can use the download version from their website which is what I did.
I used the Dragon Naturally Speaking download version on a Windows 8.1 laptop. You couldn't have asked for a smoother download. Within minutes, I was up and running and ready to let Dragon do my typing for me. I ran into a little glitch when my virus software spotted a virus on the download. I wasn't sure if it was just the antivirus software that was being touchy or if it was an actual virus. I then ended up using the CD for download to play it safe.
The program is very easy to use. There were a few typos along the way, maybe because I speak fast. The software kept up with me though! You need to tell the program when you want punctuation.
I only hesitate on the 5 star due to the virus on their download site.

product.title: Nuance Dragon Dragon NaturallySpeaking Home 13 (Old Version)

history.review_excerpt: And despite demanding my email address so I could continue watching where I left off.........it doesn't remember where I left off.The buffering is super aggravating too....and Netflix/Prime Video/HBO all work fine so it's NOT my connection. The buffering during the ads is even worse, and if there's anything worst than a lame ad about constipation, it's a lame ad about constipation that freezes with a the buffering spinning wheel of death for two minutes. So disappointing to come back to the tv from the kitchen to find the same ad still playing. But there's nothing you can do...can't fast forward or anything, only exit the app if it hangs for too long. Then you get to try to remember where you were in the show you were watching, and then try to fast forward to that point without seeing what you're forwarding through.
history.review_full: Yeah, this app needs serious work. It's glitchy as heck. The first day I've used it I've had to exit out of the app and restart it. And despite demanding my email address so I could continue watching where I left off.........it doesn't remember where I left off.The buffering is super aggravating too....and Netflix/Prime Video/HBO all work fine so it's NOT my connection. The buffering during the ads is even worse, and if there's anything worst than a lame ad about constipation, it's a lame ad about constipation that freezes with a the buffering spinning wheel of death for two minutes. So disappointing to come back to the tv from the kitchen to find the same ad still playing. But there's nothing you can do...can't fast forward or anything, only exit the app if it hangs for too long. Then you get to try to remember where you were in the show you were watching, and then try to fast forward to that point without seeing what you're forwarding through. The app definitely needs work.
history.review_title: Glitchy app constantly buffers on Fire TV

history.review_excerpt: I like it. I’m only a few lessons in, but I’m enjoying this. I really like that it uses speech recognition when you’re saying the words. Activating the subscription was painless, and I’ve had no issues using on my computer or iPad. In stark contrast to Rosetta Stone, which makes multiple device use just about impossible. Definitely give this a try. You can do the first lesson free to see if you like the method.
history.review_full: I like it. I’m only a few lessons in, but I’m enjoying this. I really like that it uses speech recognition when you’re saying the words. Activating the subscription was painless, and I’ve had no issues using on my computer or iPad. In stark contrast to Rosetta Stone, which makes multiple device use just about impossible. Definitely give this a try. You can do the first lesson free to see if you like the method.
history.review_title: So far I’m having fun with this.

history.review_excerpt: I pay for this channel as part of my cable subscription, yet I have never seen so many ads on any other app on my fire TV. what’s most annoying about that is that the ads are, number one, repetitive. Not only do you see the same ad at every commercial break, you often see the same add two or three times in a row. Second, the ads are a way higher video quality than the programming, and they often pause the feed to lock up and fail, booting you back to the home screen on the fire TV. And when you go back to your show, you have to watch the same seven ads again. Really, really aggravating.
history.review_full: I pay for this channel as part of my cable subscription, yet I have never seen so many ads on any other app on my fire TV. what’s most annoying about that is that the ads are, number one, repetitive. Not only do you see the same ad at every commercial break, you often see the same add two or three times in a row. Second, the ads are a way higher video quality than the programming, and they often pause the feed to lock up and fail, booting you back to the home screen on the fire TV. And when you go back to your show, you have to watch the same seven ads again. Really, really aggravating.

heldout.review_excerpt: I’ve had root canals that caused me less pain than this app. It is clunky and slow and glitchy and crashy. It constantly reboots when I’m trying to load something. It hangs up and buffers while playing. Miraculously, the commercials seem to do just fine. Funny how that works. I’m now watching the show on my iPad from the NBC webpage, because that’s the only way it works. I truly wish I could give this negative stars.

history.review_excerpt: Don't suffer using the stock headstrap any longer than you have to. I used the Kiwi for a while and found the Bobo to be better. I was worried about Bobos halo headstrap staying in place while exercising and playing more active games but I've had no issues so far. The hot swapping batteries are awesome and super convenient. There is a trade off with not being able to sit back comfortably. The only time I notice is when I'm playing BigScreen. Thanks for making a great product.

history.review_excerpt: I'd give them 5 stars if they had a passthrough for the Quest 2 wrist straps. They pretty quick and easy to snap on and off the controllers if it weren't for the wrist straps. Seems like an oversight on the design. My wife prefers to play without them because the grips are too big for her hands to hold comfortably. They don't hold exactly like a pistol because of the shape of the Quest controller with the sensor ring. There's no beaver tail and it's a little awkward with the thumbs for two handed grips. These are nitpicks though. Mostly they are awesome.

heldout.review_excerpt: This rig looks like a camping chair but actually holds up well. Obviously it does flex a bit at the wheel deck, but is fun to play with the pedals are sturdy enough (which is what matters the most for consistent lap times). It is more of a production than I expected to set it up and fold it up for storage but it is a big plus that it's collapsible at all. My biggest disappointment is with the formula car driving position. I ended up giving up on it and just using the GT car driving position exclusively. Now that the GT Lite Pro is out, I recommend looking at that for more comfort and stability before buying this since the formula driving position is pretty janky anyway.
heldout.review_full: This rig looks like a camping chair but actually holds up well. I use the Thrustmaster TGT with the load cell pedal set from the same brand. Obviously it does flex a bit at the wheel deck, but is fun to play with the pedals are sturdy enough (which is what matters the most for consistent lap times). It is more of a production than I expected to set it up and fold it up for storage but it is a big plus that it's collapsible at all. My biggest disappointment is with the formula car driving position. I ended up giving up on it and just using the GT car driving position exclusively. Now that the GT Lite Pro is out, I recommend looking at that for more comfort and stability before buying this since the formula driving position is pretty janky anyway.
heldout.review_title: I recommend the new GT Lite Pro model over this one.

history.review_excerpt:
But this guitar is flat-out uncomfortable and painful to use in Rock Band.

I'm talking about your strumming arm - the part of your forearm that contacts the edge of the guitar is just beat-up to no end while you're playing. There's no comfortable place to put your arm anywhere on the guitar while strumming. In stark contrast, the standard Rock Band Fender guitars always have a nice angled area that is perfectly designed for this issue.

I'm not pleased, and am planning on returning the guitar. (And I will add that playing is perfect - spot on. It's great)

One other note - I've heard from many other people online and in person that both the McCartney Bass and the Harrison Gretch have the same issue - painful strumming forearm syndrome (PSFS) "Puss-Fuss" is no laughing matter.
history.review_full:
I'm a huge Beatles, Lennon, and Rickenbacker fan. But this guitar is flat-out uncomfortable and painful to use in Rock Band.

I'm talking about your strumming arm - the part of your forearm that contacts the edge of the guitar is just beat-up to no end while you're playing. There's no comfortable place to put your arm anywhere on the guitar while strumming. In stark contrast, the standard Rock Band Fender guitars always have a nice angled area that is perfectly designed for this issue.

I'm not pleased, and am planning on returning the guitar. For this much money, it has to feel good as well as play good. (And I will add that playing is perfect - spot on. No glitches or issues with the keys, the wireless reception, nothing. It's great)

One other note - I've heard from many other people online and in person that both the McCartney Bass and the Harrison Gretch have the same issue - painful strumming forearm syndrome (PSFS) "Puss-Fuss" is no laughing matter.
history.review_title: Rickenbacker is PAINFUL to your strumming arm!

Why? It's THE BEATLES. I love every song, know them all by heart, and love playing not just along with the music, but as a Beatle!

The graphics are awesome, the RB2 format improved a little bit, and all in all, it's just a great game.

history.review_excerpt:
These would be my favorite but I have the NES and SNES style ones are those look just as good. I put a photo with an original gameboy and another Gameboy style controller for reference and they look great together.

I love their Joy-Con shells. I have about 5 different sets. These soft touch feel great on the hands and the buttons are sturdy. Be warned that lighter colors of soft touch dirty really quickly and I have no idea how to clean them.

I rated the installation a bit lower but it isn’t the shell’s fault. I can’t speak to their tools because I have a whole set from Kobalt and it’s all I ever use for these projects.
history.review_full:
This design looks great! These would be my favorite but I have the NES and SNES style ones are those look just as good. I put a photo with an original gameboy and another Gameboy style controller for reference and they look great together.

I love their Joy-Con shells. I have about 5 different sets. These soft touch feel great on the hands and the buttons are sturdy. Be warned that lighter colors of soft touch dirty really quickly and I have no idea how to clean them.

I rated the installation a bit lower but it isn’t the shell’s fault. The Joy-Con are a pain to deal with if you don’t know what you’re doing and all the parts are small. Especially the screws. Just take your time and be gentle and patient. I can’t speak to their tools because I have a whole set from Kobalt and it’s all I ever use for these projects.

history.review_excerpt:
So when they announced an ultimate controller with Hall Effect sticks, I was all over it.

Hall Effect sticks are of course sticks that use magnets to track positioning so there aren’t any parts that touch, eliminating stick drift altogether since there aren’t any parts that wear.

It works effectively the same as the Pro 2 where you can customize it by the app on your phone, you can have 3 profiles set up for different games and button setups. Granted, not the 80 hours of the Switch Pro controller but can’t complain about 30-40 hours.

I don’t use any other controller for my Switch since getting this controller.
history.review_full:
I love 8bitdo products. So when they announced an ultimate controller with Hall Effect sticks, I was all over it.

Hall Effect sticks are of course sticks that use magnets to track positioning so there aren’t any parts that touch, eliminating stick drift altogether since there aren’t any parts that wear.

It works effectively the same as the Pro 2 where you can customize it by the app on your phone, you can have 3 profiles set up for different games and button setups. It has 2 back buttons which I love because I have grown to dislike clicking in sticks as a button and program the buttons to do that function instead.

I only use mine for the Nintendo Switch. It has completely replaced the Switch Pro controller. Now I don’t have to worry about any stick drift ever developing and also it just feels better than the Switch Pro. It doesn’t have HD Rumble or the NFC for amiibo support, but who’s doing that anymore? It does have motion control as I played through Metroid Prime using motion to make the morph ball jump.

I see this question a lot on this product: can it wake the Switch? YES. It can wake the Switch, you just have to shake the controller after turning it on. I also have the controller dock connected to the Switch dock so the controller is always charged when I’m ready for it. Even though the battery life is great. Granted, not the 80 hours of the Switch Pro controller but can’t complain about 30-40 hours.

I don’t use any other controller for my Switch since getting this controller. It’s a great value for the price and the best controller 8bitdo has ever made out of their already stellar lineup.
history.review_title: Probably the best controller I own

product.title: 8Bitdo Ultimate Bluetooth Controller with Charging Dock, Wireless Pro Controller with Hall Effect Sensing Joystick, Compatible with Switch, Windows and Steam Deck (White)

history.review_excerpt:
These batteries solved that problem.

I bought these as they aren’t expensive and it wouldn’t hurt to try them. The SP battery is an easily user swapped part as the door compartment is just one screw on the bottom. Take the old battery out, put the new battery in, close the compartment door and that’s it you’re done.

I charged it up and both SPs seem to work just fine. I have actually forgotten I have swapped the batteries out for these until I saw this review request so I’m going to say they work as advertised. 😅 I kept my original batteries just in case but I don’t feel the need to have to put them back in.
history.review_full:
These are a good replacement for the SP battery. I felt like the ones in my SPs were not lasting as long, and one may actually may be bad. It was almost immediately turning the light red as if it was dying after charging overnight. These batteries solved that problem.

I bought these as they aren’t expensive and it wouldn’t hurt to try them. They seem to work just fine. The SP battery is an easily user swapped part as the door compartment is just one screw on the bottom. Take the old battery out, put the new battery in, close the compartment door and that’s it you’re done.

I charged it up and both SPs seem to work just fine. I have actually forgotten I have swapped the batteries out for these until I saw this review request so I’m going to say they work as advertised. 😅 I kept my original batteries just in case but I don’t feel the need to have to put them back in.

heldout.review_excerpt:
It’s fantastic.

You can use it on your PC (I don’t have one) and on your phone as well, but I mainly used it on Switch and I have had no issues with it. Just keep in mind that the layout is like a Switch Pro (B before A and Y before X) if you do use it to play let’s say Game Pass on your phone or something.

Battery life seems to be good as well. Aren’t really to many replaceable parts at all really but it’s really well made so it shouldn’t be necessary.

I only have one complaint. This is personal preference of course and I’m sure I’d get used to it, but for example playing smash instead of starting a match with + I press the Home button every single time.
heldout.review_full:
This is a very well designed controller. It looks real nice with the metal touches at the top for the shoulder buttons and on the sticks. It’s a blend of the Switch Pro controller and the Xbox Elite controller, without the extra features and elite provides. It feels really good in the hands, weighty but not too much. A huge plus of course is Hall Effect sticks. These sticks will never drift as there are no parts that grind up against each other. Just a great addition and more companies, especially the first parties should start doing this as soon as possible.

The buttons are nice and responsive. Better than the Switch Pro buttons in my opinion which feel a bit squishy. The sticks feel great also. I like my sticks with a little more resistance but again, I feel it’s better than the Switch Pro’s sticks. The DPad is stellar. Comparing again to the Pro, it’s soooo much better. I have a first run Pro so the DPad gives missed inputs ALL the time. Playing NES or SNES you shouldn’t have to think that you may press the wrong direction and you won’t with this controller. It’s fantastic.

You can use it on your PC (I don’t have one) and on your phone as well, but I mainly used it on Switch and I have had no issues with it. It pairs immediately and saves the pairing so it’s ready to go. Never felt like I lost connection or that the inputs were unresponsive. Just keep in mind that the layout is like a Switch Pro (B before A and Y before X) if you do use it to play let’s say Game Pass on your phone or something.

Battery life seems to be good as well. I was going to charge it when I received it but, it said it had a full charge. I’ve had it all week and I haven’t had to charge it once. Even right now it says the battery is full. Great all around. The battery isn’t really replaceable. Aren’t really to many replaceable parts at all really but it’s really well made so it shouldn’t be necessary.

I only have one complaint. I absolutely hate where the Home/Photo and +/- buttons are placed. This is personal preference of course and I’m sure I’d get used to it, but for example playing smash instead of starting a match with + I press the Home button every single time. They are more or less in the same layout as on the Switch Pro but for some reason I gravitate to the wrong buttons. Cannot stand it as of right now.

Overall I think it’s great. My complaint is relatively minor and is just a preference. Highly recommend it. Even over the Switch Pro controller.

product.title: CNIOEPL GuliKit KingKong 2 Pro Controller for Nintendo Switch[No Drifting No Dead zone], Wireless Bluetooth Controller Joystick with Hall Effect Sensing, Auto Pilot Gaming,Motion Sense
